snippet.title: 8 food photos to make you hungry for travel
snippet.description:

http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/25/travel/food-photography-awards/index.html

snippet.title: How not to leave a wedding hungry
snippet.description:
* To hear the bride tell it, all the guests should have left stuffed. In traditional New Orleans fashion, servers passed groaning trays of shrimp remoulade, mini-muffulettas, boudin balls, crab cakes, crawfish and every oyster preparation under the sun. And the open bar flowed freely.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/24/living/wedding-food-etiquette-matrimony/index.html

snippet.title: Silvio Berlusconi to carry out community service in nursing home
snippet.description:
* Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi is to serve one year of community service at a nursing home for his conviction on tax fraud, a Milan court ruled on Tuesday.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/15/world/europe/italy-berlusconi-community-service/index.html

http://religion.blogs.cnn.com/2014/03/01/stepping-stones-to-safety-a-family-flees-syrias-war-and-finds-refuge-in-italys-islands/

snippet.title: Why should you care about saints?
snippet.description:
* On Sunday, April 27, in Rome, Pope John Paul II and Pope John XXIII will be canonized as saints of the Roman Catholic Church. This event clearly will have intense significance for Catholics, but what about everyone else? Why should non-Catholics even care?
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/25/opinion/perry-canonization-saints/index.html
